author: marioevz
content:
I was working on a test requested by <@360491619402776577> regarding EIP-3860, and the tx pool, the test was supposed to send tx with `initcode>MAX_INITCODE_SIZE` before and after Shanghai, and the `eth_sendRawTransaction` was supposed to accept the tx before the fork and reject it only afterwards, but both geth and nethermind seem to be rejecting it before, and I guess this is ok since this is left to client specific behavior, but just to confirm, are all clients going to do this ?

And to clarify, the test is not meant to test transaction inclusion in blocks, only rejection from RPCs, tx pool.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think its okay to reject the tx before the fork. We just merged the change recently so old versions should still be able to execute those transactions

author: marioevz
content: I'll also check that newPayloadV2 returns invalid if these txs are included

author: dimitry8570
content: You can actually make a test with the block that has this transaction in the rlp and see if it gets verified on block import

author: marioevz
content: Yes, the test already exists in the execution-spec-tests, but I wanted to test the tx pool with this other one, because Marius found a bug where a tx with an initcode exceeding the limit was not rejected
